intro: Capnorchis canadensis, commonly known as the Canadian orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing pale yellow or greenish-white blossoms with a distinct, sweet scent. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands, often growing along streams or in swampy areas. Capnorchis canadensis is a rare and endangered species, requiring specific ecological conditions for successful growth and reproduction.
